intro: Boykinia richardsonii, commonly known as the Richardson's rock白菜, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are typically covered in a dense layer of white, woolly hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
